column1: Increased Levels of Prolactin in the Blood
column2: Mookie, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Diagnosed with 1.5mm Prolactinoma with blood levels of prolactin at +2500 (normal being <20) in June of 2009... 3 years ago.   I started taking .75mg doses of Cabergoline twice each week.  I tolerated the drug very well for 2 years... had some dry eyes, a little dizziness but not much more.  In the past 6 months I have developed some lupis type symptoms.  Dry eyes, headaches, on my fingers & toes I am getting white & blue patches with some red spots that have a little burning sensation... ruptured capillaries.  I have some shortness of breath and some itchyness on my gums.  Going to see the Endo Doc in a few weeks to see if cutting back on the dosage is wize.

column1: Increased Levels of Prolactin in the Blood
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have just begun taking Cabergoline, 1st dose of 0.25mg (1/2 tab.) this past Friday. I was diagnosed with a Macro Prolactinoma back in 2007 and have been taking Bromocriptine (Parlodel) ever since with great success; my Prolactin is normal and the tumor has shrunk to half it's original size. However, recently a new Endocrinologist I was referred to wanted me to try Cabergoline, said it was "newer, better, faster, targeted to the tumor, less side effects" etc. Made it sound like a miracle silver bullet for Pituitary Tumors. Well, since that first dose 4 days ago I have been experiencing dizziness, major nausea, extreme fatigue, acid stomach no matter what I eat, increased bathroom trips, dismal mood swings, mind fog/difficulty concentrating, shaky and sweaty (esp. at night). Basically, I feel awful! From what I read in these reviews this sounds, with a few exceptions, like everyone else's experiences to some degree or other. Personally, this is not worth it at all. Since fertility is not an issue for me there is no other reason I can see to stay on this drug when the other one I was taking was working just fine without this extreme level of side effects. I really do wish this drug had been easier to tolerate, but I guess each person reacts differently. Good luck to anyone who tries it.

column2: Registered Nurse, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed with my pit. tumor when I was 18. I was given Dostinex (Cabergoline)to take twice a week by mouth. I was also put on birth control to help regulate my periods. I never had surgery to have my pit. tumor removed. After taking the Cabergoline for about a year, I got tired of the way it made me feel; even though, it caused my prolactin levels to return to normal. So, I stopped taking it. My prolactin levels are checked about every 6 months and they are still normal even without medication. I had gained weight also before being diagnosed. After I lost some of that weight, I began to have regular periods on my own without the birth control. I then gainned some of the weight back and began having problems with my period again. So now I am back on the birth control, hopefully until I can lose weight. My gynecologist told me that when you are overweight it can also cause irregular periods. Anyway, I hope that eventually I can lose enough weight, have regular periods on my own, maintain my normal prolactin levels and have a baby! I am looking to get married soon and start my own family, but as for now I will continue to not use the Cabergoline.

column9: I had a pit/tum removed in 04, 4yrs later started having symptoms again. Went to endo and started on med, 1/2pill 2x wk, got my "lady" the very next day. Had some nausea, dizziness and headaches but no more bothersome than before my surgery. I got tired more often and had to stop my "margarita/spa treatments" due to not knowing how alcohol would affect me or the meds. I took the meds for about five months but unfortunately wasnt able to return to the dr to follow up, and ended up off meds for about four months. The symptoms returned and now I am back on the meds. Its been three wks now, and still no "Aunt Flo", this time however, I don't mind that part. The only other issues are that I have gained weight and my mind seems foggy or not as sharp and forgetfull. I am trying really hard to excercise my mind and body and try to get back to the old me. Oh yeah, one BIG problem was the decreased sex drive..still working on that. My moods swing up and down but this time around I'm following up on my apppointments and hopefully, I will be back on my game soon.

column9: I'm a migraine sufferer and started having migraines more frequently (roughly 5 a week) I had had a migraine about everyday for 2 weeks went to the emergency room for relief.  I had never had a CT so the ER Dr ordered one, showed a mass on my pituitary, they then did an MRI which confirmed the CT scan I had a tumor about the size of a walnut, prolactin levels came back at 1446.  Started on Cabergoline .25 mg 2 times a week, within 8 weeks, my level was down to 103 and the tumor had shrunk nearly in 1/2.  Very pleased with this medication.  Scheduled for another MRI in July.  Very blessed because I was told if it went much longer I would have probably lost my eyesight because of the tumor.

column9: I was diagnosed with macroprolactin adenoma. My tumor was 12mm and my prolactin level was 450+. I've been on Cabergoline for the last two years and my levels are around 3 - 5 and my tumor has shrunk to 8mm. I've experienced nausea, weight gain, and tiredness but decreased my dosage to 1/2 a pill twice weekly (which I take at night) and take a multivitamin. It's helped with some of the symptoms. I'm now pregnant and off the med but under close doctor supervision. There is a chance the tumor will return now that I'm off the med and I will be unable to breastfeed as I will return to the med immediately after childbirth. But I'm grateful I now to even have the opportunity to live a somewhat normal life. Hang in there those of you who are just starting out.

column9: I am a man and noticed a lump under my left nipple. I was concerned it might be breast cancer. My endocrinologist did some blood work and determined that my prolactin levels were higher than the normal range for a man and my testosterone was very low. I also had a strong urge to go shopping for shoes! (Just kidding). She ordered an MRI of my pituitary which was negative for any tumor. She put me on Cabergoline and my prolactic level was soon less than 1 and my testosterone was well within the normal range. The lump in my nipple has also disappeared. I'm not sure if I will have to take this medication indefinitely or not. I haven't had any side effects. I always take it before bed. Good luck.

column1: Increased Levels of Prolactin in the Blood
column2: Arnold James, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: My diagnosis is idiopathic hyperprolactinmea (sp?) Which means we don't know why (idiopathic) you have a high prolactin level (hyperprolactinmea). I had side effects from high prolactin level.  zero sex drive, tired all the time, moody, etc. Doc did hormone panel test. Prolactin cancels out testosterone. So, became sterile within a month of the side effects.  Doc sent me to endocrinologist for MRI. No tumor. Still taking this for just over 1 year. No longer sterile, in fact testost. went way up like an 18 year old for about 2 mths. then leveled off to normal. only a trace of prolactin now. Still no tumor on MRI. Could be from using Rrogaine according to my fiance and her research. Endocrinologist said that I could have a tumor just to small to see on MRI. It could stay that way forever or suddenly grow. My understanding though is that this medication reverses the effects of the high prolactin level but does not TREAT the tumor to shrink or stop growth, that is all up to the tumor. Many people have this & don't know until autopsy after dying from something else. Live their whole life w/it just no serious effects so no tests. A good book to read is by Ken Baker. He had his removed, in his 20s and is married with two children. Others complain about being tired but I didn't notice but I'm a hyper person. I have had nothing but good from this medication.

The only side effect I can notice is feeling a little groggy the morning after taking the pill. It's been great!

column1: Increased Levels of Prolactin in the Blood
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: After over 2 years of infertility treatments, my new doctor did an MRI and found I had a pituitary tumor (microadenoma). Many people don't realize that increased prolactin levels can cause you not to ovulate, and therefore, you can't get pregnant. I was misdiagnosed as having polycystic ovarian syndrome for 8 years. I didn't have increased milk production, so this was never considered by my other doctors. I've been on the medicine for about 5 months now (1 pill twice a week). I just found out I'm 4 weeks pregnant! After 6 years of trying and even using Clomid (fertility meds), this medicine solved my problems in just a few months. :)As a side note, I never had any issues with dizziness or fatigue. I would always take my medicine after a meal or before I went to sleep.

column9: I only take 1/2 a tablet a week. This medicine is beginning to decrease my prolactin levels. I do feel tired when taking this medicine, but glad I am, as it is uncomfortable to have uwanted breast milk that is not needed. I find it unusual that I have high prolactin levels, I haven't had any children yet. My doctor doesn't know why either. Can anyone help me answer this?

column9: I started taking Cabergoline at the end of December and had dizziness and headaches.  I found that if I drank a full glass of milk with the medicine I was great the next day.  I go back to the DR in a week to see if the medicine lower my level or not.
